fr.lipn.uima.util
Class ExternalProgram

java.lang.Object
  fr.lipn.uima.util.ExternalProgram

public class ExternalProgram
extends java.lang.Object

Used to launch an external application in a quite safe way: streams are processed in different threads which use buffering (see Java API about ProcessBuilder and Process). More precisely this class implements a simple behaviour with the external process streams:

  • the process must not expect any input stream.
  • the process error and output streams are written to two distinct StringWriter objects.
These streams must be valid text streams.
That means that this class must not be used in the case where the process expects an input stream (or any kind of interactive behaviour). Exceptions are thrown for any error which does not occur inside the external program process: I/O error with output streams, thread failures, time out, etc.
NB: The run() method waits for the process to terminate before ending. Output and error streams are available after run() has terminated (through getErrorStream() and getOutputStream()).

Important recall : launching an external application is always risky and usually not portable !

This class is inspired from ProcessLauncher, written by Fabio Marazzeto and Yann D'Isanto.

Author:
moreau

Constructor Detail

ExternalProgram

public ExternalProgram(java.util.List<java.lang.String> command,
                       long timeOut,
                       int streamBufferSize,
                       int StringBufferSize,
                       java.lang.String workingDir)
Detailed constructor. See also setIgnoreStdOut(boolean), setIgnoreStdErr(boolean), setMergeStdoutAndStderr(boolean).

Parameters:
command - command line with arguments.
timeOut - maximum execution time (in ms) before interruption (0L not to interrupt)
streamBufferSize - buffer size when reading output streams (0 to use default size)
StringBufferSize - Initial string size to store output and error streams (0 to use default size)
workingDir - Directory where the process will run (null for current directory)

ExternalProgram

public ExternalProgram(java.util.List<java.lang.String> command)
Simple constructor.

Parameters:
command - command line with arguments, see ProcessBuilder.
Method Detail

getOutputStream

public java.lang.String getOutputStream()
Returns:
the standard output of the external program; null if called before the run() method has ended or if stdout is not used (see setIgnoreStdOut(boolean))

getErrorStream

public java.lang.String getErrorStream()
Returns:
the standard error of the external program; null if called before the run() method has ended or if stderr is not used (see setIgnoreStdErr(boolean) and setMergeStdoutAndStderr(boolean))

run

public int run()
        throws ExternalProgramException
Starts the process and waits for it to end. Tries to catch any error which are not due to the process itself.

Returns:
the exit code of the process
Throws:
ExternalProgramException - for any error which is not due to the process.
